content.title: Thoracic Aortic Aneurysm - Surgical Indications
content.summary: Evidence-based size thresholds and clinical criteria for recommending prophylactic surgical intervention in thoracic aortic aneurysms to prevent rupture and dissection.

definitions.definition: The aortic diameter at which the risk of rupture/dissection exceeds the risk of surgical repair, warranting prophylactic intervention.
The diameter at which rupture risk increases sharply, approximately 6cm for ascending and 7cm for descending TAA.

key_concepts.explanation: Standard: 5.5cm. Marfan syndrome: 5.0cm (or 4.5cm with risk factors). Loeys-Dietz: 4.0-4.2cm. Bicuspid aortic valve: 5.0-5.5cm (4.5cm if risk factors). Family history of dissection, rapid growth >0.5cm/year, or severe AR lower threshold.
Standard: 5.5-6.0cm for open repair, 5.5cm for TEVAR (lower morbidity). Connective tissue disorders: lower thresholds apply. Growth rate >0.5cm/year or symptoms (pain) warrant earlier intervention.

Consider repair at 5.5-6.0cm due to operative risk. Type II TAAA has highest operative risk - may accept larger sizes in high-risk patients. Younger patients with long life expectancy may benefit from earlier repair.
Aortic size index (ASI) = diameter / BSA. ASI >2.75 cm/m² is high risk. Useful when absolute diameter is borderline. Helps avoid undersizing thresholds in small patients.

evidence.finding: Class I recommendation for surgery at 5.5cm ascending, 5.0cm in Marfan, 4.0-4.2cm in Loeys-Dietz

evidence.citation: Elefteriades et al., Yale Natural History Study, 2007
evidence.finding: Annual rupture/dissection risk: 2% at 4-4.9cm, 3% at 5-5.9cm, 7% at 6cm+ for ascending aorta

clinical_pearls: Always compare measurements at the same level using the same imaging modality
Growth rate is as important as absolute size - document prior imaging
In connective tissue disorders, use the lowest threshold that applies
Consider patient preference, operative risk, and life expectancy
Emergency repair is indicated for rupture, symptomatic aneurysm, or acute dissection
learning_objectives: State size thresholds for ascending and descending TAA repair
Apply modified thresholds for genetic syndromes
Calculate and interpret aortic size index
Recognize clinical factors that lower intervention thresholds
Compare TEVAR versus open repair thresholds
